sentences.sContent: White House officials ordered Williams to recant.
sentences.sCn: 白宫官员命令威廉斯公开宣布放弃自己的观点。

sentences.sContent: ...a man who had refused after torture to recant his heresy.
sentences.sCn: ...遭受酷刑后仍拒绝放弃其异教信仰的一名男子。

remMethod.val: re(反) ＋ cant(唱) → 唱反调 → 放弃(信仰)

trans.tranOther: If you recant, you say publicly that you no longer hold a set of beliefs that you had in the past
